intro: Cynoglossum zeylanicum var. villosulum, commonly known as hairy stock, is a flowering plant in the family Boraginaceae. It is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy blue or purple flowers that bloom in summer. Native to southern Europe and western Asia, this perennial herb thrives in well-drained soils and full sun. The plant's foliage is often covered in fine, white hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. It is cultivated for its ornamental value and has also been used in traditional medicine.
